intro: Picris humifusa, commonly known as field eryngo, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features yellow composite flowers that bloom from June to September. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are often aromatic and can be harvested for medicinal purposes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Its common name reflects its historical use in traditional remedies for ailments such as coughs and skin conditions.
